newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso weakens on interest rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso weakens on interest rate cut.

text.p: The cut in the Central Bank's overnight rate on Wednesday sent the peso lower to finish at 26.193 pesos from 26.189, traders said. The lower interest rate on the peso makes it more attractive to hold dollars.
The day's average was at 26.194 pesos to the dollar from 26.190. Volume fell to $100 million from $134.35 million.

The Central Bank cut its overnight lending and borrowing rates by 0.25 percentage point each to 13.00 percent and 10.50 respectively. Its move was intended to influence interest rates in line with expectations of lower inflation in the second half of the year.
Traders said the peso was also pulled down by a $48 million-requirement of oil companies in the next two days.
Nevertheless, a foreign bank trader believes banks who bought up the dollar made the wrong move.
